author: Kimberly Ricci
title: Mark Cuban Delivers A Fitting Response To Trump’s Out-Of-Nowhere Twitter Attack
text:
Getty Image
Donald Trump woke up on Sunday morning just like any other normal day. That is, he impulsively selected a target and fired away without thinking of how silly it looks for the U.S. president to beef on social media. The rest of us have that luxury, but Trump perhaps should have been hunkering down with some policy advisors over North Korea’s missile-related muscle flexing , which was big news on Saturday night. Yet Trump decided to resurrect his feud with billionaire Mark Cuban.
I know Mark Cuban well. He backed me big-time but I wasn't interested in taking all of his calls.He's not smart enough to run for president!
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 12, 2017 

Seriously, what is going on? The out-of-the-blue nature of the attack was worth noticing. Maybe Trump was dreaming that Cuban supported him?
Cuban made it very clear that he supported Hillary Clinton (even calling Trump “a jagoff” during an endorsement speech). He continued to speak out against Trump throughout election season on matters of policy and called out lies when the opportunity struck. And of course, Cuban perched in the front row of a debate while hoping to be Trump’s grim spectre of doom .
Well, the Dallas Mavericks owner responded to Trump with a trio of tweets, but his most immediate response was … laughter.
Lol https://t.co/c4VkkX3ODP 
— Mark Cuban (@mcuban) February 12, 2017 

He then posted a “how soon they forget” reminder that showed his very negative response to Trump, which the then-candidate sent over after a Cuban CNN appearance.
How soon they forget …. pic.twitter.com/VXcfnjj4qX 
— Mark Cuban (@mcuban) February 12, 2017 

And finally, Cuban gave some perspective. Quite frankly, he’s relieved that Trump “is tweeting rather than trying to govern.” Ouch.
I don't know. But isn't it better for all of us that he is tweeting rather than trying to govern ? https://t.co/953MuEdfeu 
— Mark Cuban (@mcuban) February 12, 2017
